posts.name: Abbott's Frozen Custard
posts.note: Abbott's Frozen Custard is a long-running chain offering sweet treats from cones to cakes, made with slow-churned frozen custard. They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Bill Gray’s
posts.note: Bill Gray’s is part of a regional chain long known for its cheeseburgers, hot dogs, and frozen custard. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Galleria Pizza
posts.note: Galleria Pizza serves pizzas featuring toppings like crab and potato skins at this bare-bones parlor with wings, pasta, and subs. From their website, 'Galleria Pizza has been serving our customers with the most mouthwatering selections of pizza, subs, sandwiches, wraps, and more since 1994. Located in downtown Rochester, NY, we offer dine-in, take-out, and delivery services at affordable prices.'

posts.name: Mamasan's Noodle Caboodle Restaurant
posts.note: Mamasan's is a hearty Thai and Vietnamese noodle and rice dishes spiced to taste in a friendly, family-run eatery. They have great Thai and Vietnamese food. I have never ordered a bad dish there.

posts.name: Nick Tahou Hots
posts.note: Nick Tahou Hots is a Rochester, NY landmark restaurant famous for its Garbage Plate. The restaurant was founded by its namesake, Nick Tahou. Despite many regional variants all based on the same theme, Nick's is widely regarded as the original Garbage Plate which usually contains a mash-up of meats (hamburgers, cheese burgers, hot dogs, etc.), fries, salads, and sauces. NOTE: My New York State Trooper friends would only go in uniform after dropping people at Rochester's main police station.

posts.name: Parkside Diner
posts.note: Parkside Diner is a classic, unpretentious American restaurant with outdoor seating and an attached mini-golf course. I love ordering their create your own omelette with artichokes and sauteed mushrooms, hash browns, and a side of country toast.

posts.name: Tapas 177
posts.note: Tapas 177 serves global small plates from egg rolls to empanadas in a dimly lit space with a courtyard they even have salsa dancing. Friends and others have said their vegan dishes are astonishing, and you should order the Moroccan Vegetable Stew or the Tofu Tikka Masala or the Indian Red Lentil Idli Pancakes with vegan ricotta. From their website, 'Tapas 177 has been in business for over 20 years. Our dining menu is a creative 'fusion of familiar and exotic flavors from around the world. With over 20 appetizer choices, you can have your dinner 'tapas-style' by sharing a few from our amazing selection or order one of our fabulous entrees.'
